fullName.value: Transient receptor potential cation channel subfamily M member 8

texts.value: Non-selective ion channel permeable to monovalent and divalent cations, including Na(+), K(+), and Ca(2+), with higher permeability for Ca(2+). Activated by multiple factors, such as temperature, voltage, pressure, and changes in osmolality. Activated by cool temperatures (<23-28 degrees Celsius) and by chemical ligands evoking a sensation of coolness, such as menthol and icilin therefore plays a central role in the detection of environmental cold temperatures (PubMed:15306801, PubMed:15852009, PubMed:16174775, PubMed:25559186, PubMed:37857704). TRPM8 is a voltage-dependent channel; its activation by cold or chemical ligands shifts its voltage thresholds towards physiological membrane potentials, leading to the opening of the channel (PubMed:15306801). In addition to its critical role in temperature sensing, regulates basal tear secretion by sensing evaporation-induced cooling and changes in osmolality (By similarity). May plays a role in prostate cancer cell migration (PubMed:16174775, PubMed:25559186)
Negatively regulates menthol- and cold-induced channel activity by stabilizing the closed state of the channel
Negatively regulates menthol- and cold-induced channel activity by stabilizing the closed state of the channel

Activated by cold temperatures and by both natural and synthetic cooling compounds such as menthol and icilin (PubMed:15306801, PubMed:16174775). Activation of the channel requires the presence of PI(4,5)P2. PI(4,5)P2 regulates the activation and desensitization of TRPM8 channels (PubMed:15852009). Activated by intracellular Ca(2+) (PubMed:15852009)

Homotetramer (PubMed:37857704). Isoform 2 and isoform 3 interact with the C-terminus of isoform 1 in a thermosensitive manner with decreased interaction at 21 degrees Celsius compared to 37 degrees Celsius (PubMed:22128173). Interacts (via N-terminus and C-terminus domains) with TCAF1; the interaction stimulates TRPM8 channel activity (PubMed:25559186). Interacts (via N-terminus and C-terminus domains) with TCAF2 isoform 2; the interaction inhibits TRPM8 channel activity (PubMed:25559186)
Lipid raft association modulates TRPM8 channel activity (By similarity). Located in the endoplasmic reticulum in prostate cancer cells (PubMed:11325849, PubMed:16174775)
Expressed in prostate. Also expressed in prostate tumors and in non-prostatic primary tumors such as colon, lung, breast and skin tumors
The coiled coil region is required for multimerization
Cooling agents bind within a pocket formed entirely by the S1-S4 helices that opens to the cytoplasm
Its expression in most prostate tumors as well as the presence of an immunogenic epitope suggest that it may be suitable for the design of peptide vaccination strategies for prostate cancers
Belongs to the transient receptor (TC 1.A.4) family. LTrpC subfamily. TRPM8 sub-subfamily

features.description: Transient receptor potential cation channel subfamily M member 8
Epitope; activates specific cytotoxic T lymphocytes
Abolishes ion channel activity to cold stimulis.
Does not affect ion channel activity to cold stimulis.
Abolishes ion channel activity activation by icilin. Does not affect ion channel activity activation by menthol or cooling agent-10.
Decreases ion channel sensitivity to cold stimulis.
No effect on glycosylation or ability to form functional channels.
No effect on glycosylation or channel activity.
Decreases in sensitivity to PI(4,5)P2. Insensitive to icilin.
Decreases in sensitivity to PI(4,5)P2. Reduced the sensitivity of the channel to menthol stimulation. Insensitive to icilin.
Abolishes multimerization and channel activity. Reduces cell surface expression.

citation.title: Trp-p8, a novel prostate-specific gene, is up-regulated in prostate cancer and other malignancies and shares high homology with transient receptor potential calcium channel proteins.
Novel role of cold/menthol-sensitive transient receptor potential melastatine family member 8 (TRPM8) in the activation of store-operated channels in LNCaP human prostate cancer epithelial cells.
Regulation of activity of transient receptor potential melastatin 8 (TRPM8) channel by its short isoforms.
Generation and annotation of the DNA sequences of human chromosomes 2 and 4.
The status, quality, and expansion of the NIH full-length cDNA project: the Mammalian Gene Collection (MGC).
Molecular cloning of a novel member of LTRP channel family, LTRPC6.
Identification of an HLA-A*0201-restricted T-cell epitope derived from the prostate cancer-associated protein trp-p8.
The principle of temperature-dependent gating in cold- and heat-sensitive TRP channels.
PI(4,5)P2 regulates the activation and desensitization of TRPM8 channels through the TRP domain.
